defect.para: The vehicles involved are Volunteer and AmTran Conventional model school buses with handrails mounted forward of the entrance door, built from January 1, 1991 through January 20, 1997.
American Transportation Corporation (AmTran) has determined that a defect relating to motor vehicle safety exists in some AmTran Conventional and Volunteer vehicles in connection with the handrails.

Optional handrail mounted forward of the entrance door (to right when entering bus) on subject vehicles may have an entanglement hazard located at the lower attachment point of the handrail and the sidewall of the stepwell. Certain small objects may be caught in these areas such as coat tie strings with draw string clips or other objects attached. Should this happen, and the driver does not properly observe the person exiting the bus, the person may exit the bus with the string captured. The door may be closed and the bus moved causing possible injury or death to the passenger exiting the bus.

step1.para: Check bus to see if it is equipped with a handrail mounted forward of the entrance door and with the lower attachment point on the vertical surface of the stepwell enclosure.

If a handrail is not present forward of the entrance door, or if lower attachment point is on the horizontal floor surface, no other action is necessary. Fill out and return reply card. If a handrail is present with the lower attachment, as described above, proceed to repair instructions.

Remove and discard entire handrail and attachment brackets. Replace fasteners to fill existing holes. Return reply card. No additional action is necessary. NOTE: If the removal of this handrail prevents this bus from meeting state specification (i.e., Ohio), proceed to Step 2 for rework instructions.

If local or state specifications do not allow removal of the handrail, order rubber spacer repair kit #436496001 by returning the enclosed card or call AmTran Customer Service at (800) 843-5615. A repair kit containing hardware and detailed instructions will be sent to you. Install the rubber spacer at the lower attachment point of the handrail using the fastener provided.

Check for correct installation. Tie 1/2 inch nut to one end of string (provided). Gradually pull the string across all handrail attachment points making an effort to catch the string or nut. Using nut and string, attempt to catch the nut between the handrail and any structure or object near the handrail. A failure has occurred if the string or nut is caught in a crevice or between the handrail and any other surface.
Complete and return the owners postage-paid "Recall - Repair Reply Card."

entry.para: *Required only if removal of handrail is not permitted due to state or local specification.

laborinfo.para: The pre-approved labor time allowed for modification is twelve (12) minutes.
TOOLS REQUIRED: 1/2 inch socket or 1/2 inch wrench

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. As a precaution, you should not operate any of the vehicles subject to this recall campaign until they have been inspected for the presence of the nut assembled to the pinch bolt. In the event that the nut is missing, repairs must be made before the vehicle is driven. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
